heading: ID
comment: The identifier given to the place, corresponding to that used in the collection files.

heading: URI (TGN)
comment: The URI given to the place within the Getty Vocabularies database, as encoded within a @target attribute to a ref element with a corresponding value in a title element.

heading: other ref(s)
comment: Other references given for the place, as encoded within a @target attribute to a ref element without a title element corresponding to the databases defined for the preceding columns.

heading: other URI(s)
comment: Other references given for the place, as encoded within a @target attribute to a ref element without a title element corresponding to the databases defined for the preceding columns.

heading: index
comment: The standard name assigned to the place.

heading: variant
comment: Any variant name(s) assigned to the place.

heading: type
comment: The type of region, as encoded in the @type attribute. Values are 'settlement', 'region', and 'country'.

heading: geo
comment: The geographic latitude and longitude of the place.

heading: geo source
comment: The source of the latitude and longitude information. Usually a URI.

heading: latitude
comment: The geographic latitude of the place, formatted as a number.

heading: longitude
comment: The geographic longitude of the place, formatted as a number.

heading: region
comment: If the place is a settlement, then the region associated with the place.

heading: region ID
comment: If the place is a settlement, then the identifier, corresponding with a place elsewhere in the same file, given to the region associated with the place. This column will be empty as regions don't have @key attributes, but may in future.

heading: country
comment: If the place is a settlement or a region, then the country associated with the place.

heading: country ID
comment: If the place is a settlement or a region, then the identifier, corresponding with a place elsewhere in the same file, given to the country associated with the place.

heading: bibl(s)
comment: All bibliographic references associated with this place, as encoded within bibl elements.

heading: note(s)
comment: Notes about the place, as given within a child note element to the place element.
